pageContext.claim: “If you remember last time against Crooked Hillary, I had a debate where they oscillated my mic, and they were forced to apologize. Legally, they were forced to apologize. They would turn my mic down, up and down, whenever I'd look at her, and we caught them, and they actually apologized.”
pageContext.analysis: The Commission on Presidential Debates never apologized for Trump's microphone issue at the first debate between Trump and Hillary Clinton in 2016, nor did it say there was any deliberate manipulation of the microphone. In a brief statement, the commission only had said: "Regarding the first debate, there were issues regarding Donald Trump's audio that affected the sound level in the debate hall." The CPD indicated that the issue did not affect the television broadcast.
